text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with smoked turkey and spring pea
fettuccine that's right i don't always
use cream sauces when I make pastas but
when I do I prefer this recipe and while
it may not be the most interesting pasta
in the world it's certainly one of the
most delicious and just incredibly easy
to make and by the way I'm a little
nostalgic for this recipe in that it was
the first pasta recipe I ever made in
San Francisco at my very first chef job
true story so to start off I'm going to
pick some tarragon leaves and not only
is the flavor perfect but it's so easy
to pick unlike other herbs like thyme
thyme is such a jerk tarragon so much
nicer just take the stem in one hand
pinch with your two fingers and just
strip the leaves right off pulling the
opposite direction they're growing and
that's it those leaves come right off
and I really want you to use tarragon
for this there's no other herb that will
pair is perfectly with that smoked
turkey and those sweet peas as tarragon
so I'm gonna strip off a bunch of leaves
we're going to chop that up and the herb
is prepped alright once our tarragon
chopped we're going to go ahead and prep
our smoked turkey the original version
of this recipe called for smoked chicken
but for whatever reason that's not as
easy to find a smoked turkey so I have a
piece of smoked turkey breast I'm just
going to cut it in slices and then in
little strips and because we're going to
toss this with fettuccine I'm going to
kind of simulate the width of a
fettuccine noodle we can't really get
the same length it's fettuccine because
you know because turkeys aren't that
long but that shapes you work fine and
then we're going to want to mince up
some garlic and shallots if you can't
find shell you could just do a little
bit of onion and that's pretty much it
for the prep there's not a lot of
ingredients in this all right we're
going to go over this stove or I have a
heavy-duty skillet set on medium heat I
have a little bit of olive oil in which
we're going to saute our shallots and
our garlic but only for a few seconds
maybe 30 seconds just give it a little
sizzle all right we don't want any color
on there at that point I want you to
dump in your smoked turkey and I have a
theory that the smokiness of the turkey
will adhere better to the oil in the pan
than if we just dumped it into the cream
now like most of my theories I don't
really have any proof but it feels right
okay so we're gonna dump that in and
we're only going to stir that around for
a minute again I'm scared of burning the
garlic it's really the only way to ruin
this so cook that turkey stirring for
about a minute
and at that point we're going to dump in
our heavy cream and a good amount of it
we're going to give that a stir
we're going to raise the heat up to
medium-high because we want to bring
this up to a boil and while we're
waiting for that to happen let's go
ahead and season this up with a little
bit of cayenne a little bit of freshly
ground black pepper and a pinch of salt
and eventually that will come up to a
boil and we're going to just boil that
for about five minutes until it's
slightly thickens all right now while
that's happening you might as well go
ahead and boil your fettuccine the great
thing about this recipe is the sauce is
going to take about as long as it takes
to make your pasta so to boil my
fettuccine in salted water that's going
to take about seven or eight minutes and
while that's boiling right next to my
sauce I'm going to keep an eye on my
cream all right be careful cream loves
to boil over so feel free to adjust your
heat so about five minutes later I'm
going to turn this down to low and you
can see it just slightly thickened
alright now it's hard to give exact time
so I'm going to say about five minutes
that takes but you're going to keep an
eye on it bottom line is should
basically look like this and at that
point we're going to add our peas now of
course you can use fresh peas or frozen
peas which did I use I prefer not to say
then we stir the peas in and just keep
that on low until your pasta is ready
which should just be like a minute or
two all right
again we're boiling the pasta while
we're making the sauce and by the way
quick tip if your creme reduced too far
just add a splash of the pasta water and
then once your pasta is perfect which
means it's about a half a minute
underdone we're going to drain it very
well we're going to dump it into our
sauce along with all that freshly
chopped tarragon and then just a little
grating of lemon zest just a little
touch I'm just using the microplane and
I'm just going to stir that over low
heat for about a minute until all that
lusciousness is combined and by the way
to show my love to plant munchers if you
want to do a meatless version substitute
sauteed mushrooms for the turkey but
cook them with a little bit of smoked
paprika so you do get that little bit of
smoky element which works so well with
that sweet pea and tarragon cream sauce
all right so if you're not into the
turkey try that and then last but not
least you're going to taste that for
seasoning and if everything's looking
feeling and tasting good go ahead and
serve that up in a bowl possibly finish
that off with a little dusting of
parmesan and that is done smoked turkey
spring pea fettuccine
and like I said earlier I don't make
that many cream sauce pastas generally
preferring the olive oil and tomato
based versions but this is just so
over-the-top delicious and yes very rich
alright this recipe makes for appetizer
size portions which is how I think you
should serve it for me this is a little
rich for an entire plate but suit
yourself but above and beyond that
luxurious creamy sauce this has such a
great combination of flavors there's
something about those sweet peas and
that smoked turkey that just pairs so
well with tarragon which has that subtly
sweet kind of licorice aniseed flavor
it's just a beautiful beautiful thing so
I really hope you give this a try head
over to food wishes comm for all the
ingredient amounts and more infos usual
and as always enjoy
[Music]
